title: Fourbeard rockling

content.title: External appearance
content.content: The fourbeard rockling has a slender body with small scales. Its back can be bluish or brownish grey. Its characteristic feature is an elongated barbel on its chin. In the Baltic Sea, it can reach a maximum size of up to 36 centimetres.

content.title: Distribution
content.content: Found in the North Atlantic up to Iceland. In the Baltic Sea it occurs up to the Gulf of Finland and the Gulf of Bothnia.

content.title: Development
content.content: Usually spawns from March to August. Both eggs and larvae are pelagic.

content.title: Fishing
content.content: This species is of minor importance to both commercial fishing and anglers.

fact: Unlike other fish, the first ray of the fourbeard rockling's dorsal fin is long and prominent, making it easily distinguishable from other fish.
